intro: Hypudaeurus cenchroides, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, often blooming in early spring. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, and it is often found in open, disturbed habitats. Hypudaeurus cenchroides is an annual or biennial plant that plays a role in stabilizing sandy environments.
